title: The L Word (season 4)
text:
The fourth season of "<a href="The%20L%20Word">The L Word</a>" premiered on January 7, 2007 and ended on March 25, 2007. 12 episodes were produced this season.
Production.
Showtime announced a renewal of the series, in a February 2, 2006, press release:
The filming of the season's twelve episodes began in Vancouver, on May 29, 2006.
New cast members for the show's fourth season included <a href="Academy%20Awards">Academy-Award</a> winner <a href="Marlee%20Matlin">Marlee Matlin</a>, three time <a href="Golden%20Globe">Golden Globe</a> winner <a href="Cybill%20Shepherd">Cybill Shepherd</a>, <a href="Kristanna%20Loken">Kristanna Loken</a>, <a href="Rose%20Rollins">Rose Rollins</a>, <a href="Jessica%20Capshaw">Jessica Capshaw</a> and <a href="Janina%20Gavankar">Janina Gavankar</a>. <a href="Karina%20Lombard">Karina Lombard</a> reprised her role as <a href="Marina%20Ferrer">Marina Ferrer</a> for two episodes. Film and television star <a href="Annabella%20Sciorra">Annabella Sciorra</a> guest-starred in several episodes as lesbian film director Kate Arden, chosen to direct the film version of Jenny's story "Lez Girls".
Episodes.
